title: Ping lags and normal system lags too even though both broadband and system are working fine
body:
LoL has literally become unplayable for me. The ping stays stable at 290 ( yeah, i know it's not that great but thats normal and quite playable) but suddenly shoots to 1800 or something like that.After this the game is one fuckfest for me.Also i get system lags even though i have a pretty good system ( specs- 
Processor-i3 6100
GPU-Radeon rx 470
SSD- Samsung evo 240 GB)
I used to easily get nearly 300 fps but now days the normal is 150, which is not bad but it drops tp 20 then comes back to 240 then drops to 8 then stays at 150
I tried deleting or uninstalling a lot of programs, i deleted-
Avira antivirus
Plays tv ( Raptr screen recording thing)
Rainmeter( Desktop customization app,i though it took a lot of resources)
HP
CoreTemp
some Gpu temperature app too.

now what  should i do?

replies.body:
Since you're having multiple issues (FPS, connection), we'll need to focus on these one at a time. Let's focus on your latency (ping) issue first. Inconsistencies or jumps in latency (ping) are typically caused by certain issues along your network routing that cause your connection to take a longer path to the servers. Before we take a look at your network routing to our servers, I'd like you to work through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to ensure all your local network settings are compatible with League.

Please let me know if this caused any observable change to your latency.
